item.description: Contained Brush Fire; INC#1708; 09:32PM; 4721 E Klamath St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3VKbt7Q; El Sereno; 1/4 acre of light grass moving uphill at a slow rate of speed with no wind quickly contained and extinguished by 20 firefighters in 22 minutes. No structures damaged. No reported injuries. Cause is under active investigation; FS 16; Batt 2; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 BC2 E1 E12 E16 E2 E201 E202 E212 E44 E90 EM1 H1 H2 H3 HA1 HA2 HA3 T1 T12 T2; CH5; 13; Amy Bastman

Knockdown Structure Fire; INC#1487; 07:00PM; 5448 W Sunset Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3TjmgUR; East Hollywood; A small outside fire extended into a vacant McDonald's restaurant which was quickly extinguished by the first 12 firefighters on scene, in just 10 minutes. No reported injuries. Cause of the fire is under investigation; FS 82; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 13; BC5 E235 E35 E52 E82 RA82 T35; CH9; 13; Amy Bastman

title.a: Update Jumper Battalion 4 remains collocated with CHP and Airport Police. Expected to continue to be an extended operation that will impact LAX traffic. Please avoid the area and direct any questions to CHP LOG 1366. 10/20/2022 INC#0906

Knockdown Fatality Structure Fire; INC#0255; 06:27AM; 405 S Cliffwood Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3VB0my2; Brentwood; We arrived on scene to find a large two-story craftsman style house with lazy smoke. As firefighters made their way to the rear of the home, a significant yellow glow was apparent and we called for additional firefighters. We were told thereâ€™s possibly an elderly person inside, so with a heightened sense of urgency we commenced an aggressive interior attack and truck companies simultaneously cut holes on the roof to release the toxic smoke and gases. Firefighters inside rapidly made their way through heavy smoke conditions and quickly found the body of a 92-year-old female that was tragically determined dead in a rear bedroom on the first floor. Additional firefighters performed a thorough and strategic search of the large home to ensure no one else was inside. There were no other injuries. A total of 26 firefighters, under the command of battalion chief Joseph Everett, fully extinguished the flames in just 33 minutes. Per protocol for fatal fires, The cause is under active investigation by the LAFD Arson section. There were no functional smoke alarms found inside the home. Smoke alarms save lives. Smoke alarms that are properly installed and maintained play a vital role in reducing fire deaths and injuries. If there is a fire in your home, smoke spreads fast and you need smoke alarms to give you time to get out.; FS 19; Batt 9; West Bureau; Council District 11; BC9 CM52 E19 E237 E288 E37 E63 E69 PH1 RA19 RA59 T37 T88; CH7; David Ortiz

Structure Fire - Fatality; INC#0255; 05:54AM; 405 S Cliffwood Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3VB0my2; Brentwood; Firefighters are battling a structure fire within a two-story home. At this time, one deceased person has been found on the first floor. Firefighters are continuing to extinguish small areas of flames while doing a comprehensive search for additional occupants. ; FS 19; Batt 9; West Bureau; Council District 11; BC9 CM52 E19 E237 E288 E37 E63 E69 RA19 RA59 T37 T88; CH9; 13; Amy Bastman

Traffic; INC#1548; 07:47PM; 10500 N Sunland Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3zikw6H; Sunland; Three vehicle traffic collisions with 7 total patients. One ALS patient was transported, an additional patient declined transportation against paramedic recommendation, two patients were transported BLS, and the remaining three BLS patients declined transportation. LAPD Inc #4212; FS 24; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; BC12 E24 E274 E77 E98 EM14 HR3 RA7 RA74 RA77 RA898 T74 UR88; CH8; 17; Amy Bastman

Structure Fire; INC#1297; 05:16PM; 5188 W Pickford St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3TiOxLk; Mid-City; *Updated address* Firefighters located and extinguished heavy fire in one unit on the first floor of a two-story garden-style apartment building. The 29 LAFD firefighters achieved knockdown of the flames in just 30 minutes despite excessive storage within the unit. No reported firefighter or civilian injuries. Cause is under investigation. ; FS 68; Batt 18; South Bureau; Council District 10; BC18 E261 E61 E68 RA68 T61; CH9; 13; Amy Bastman
